bioghist.p: Villanova University traces its origins to old Saint Augustine's Church in Philadelphia, which the Augustinians founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, established in 1811. Villanova University has been sponsored by the Augustinian Order since its founding in 1842. Today, the University is comprised of five colleges: Liberal Arts and Sciences (Villanova College), Engineering, School of Business (formerly known as the College of Commerce and Finance), Nursing and the School of Law.

scopecontent.p: This is a small collection of materials related to Villanova students. Materials include news clippings about Rebecca Spies and Martin Liquori; a typed paper by William A. Butler, entitled "Elements of Mental Hygiene" (circa 1940s); verse by George C. Egan (undated); a copy of Villanova Magazine, autographed by Vicki Huber; Joseph Krzyzosiak's orientation packet (1939-1941); student activities cards of Domenic Chiappone (1951) and Cornelius I. Downey (1954); Thomas A. Luekbing's Knights of Columbus Certificate (1960); William A. Butler's grade report (1941-1946); and a number of manuscript addresses from the late nineteenth century, some in French.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
